1.text: Attach a sheet of window screen across a wooden frame.

2.text: Find recyclable paper from around your home or workplace.

3.text: Remove any plastic and staples from the paper.

4.text: Tear the paper into 2 in (5.1 cm) wide strips.

5.text: Soak the paper in warm water for 4–6 hours.

6.text: Blend the paper for at least 30 seconds to turn it into pulp.

7.text: Change the hue of your paper with food coloring.

8.text: Create seed paper by adding a handful of seeds to your slurry.

9.text: Add a pinch of glitter to the slurry to make your paper sparkle.

10.text: Fill a large pan at least one-third of the way full with warm tap water.

11.text: Pour the blended slurry into the pan.

12.text: Stir the slurry into the water until it’s an even consistency.

13.text: Immerse the screened frame in the pulp mixture.

14.text: Lift up the screen until it is above the water.

15.text: Transfer the wet sheet of paper to a soft, absorptive surface.

16.text: Lift the screen up and away from the transferred paper.

17.text: Peel the paper off the screen if it hasn’t transferred to the towels.

18.text: Set the paper out to dry overnight.

19.text: Repeat the entire process to create additional sheets of paper.
